unnormalised: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has announced the schedule for the Class 10 and 12 board examinations for the academic year 2024-25. According to the official notification released on 15/05/2024, the exams will commence on 03/03/2025 and conclude by 10/04/2025. Detailed subject-wise timetables will be available on the CBSE website, cbse.nic.in, starting 01/12/2024.
normalised: The C-B-S-E has announced the schedule for the Class ten and twelve board examinations for the academic year two thousand twenty four to twenty five. According to the official notification released on fifteenth May two thousand twenty four, the exams will commence on third March two thousand twenty five and conclude by tenth April two thousand twenty five. Detailed subject-wise timetables will be available on the C-B-S-E website, c-b-s-e dot n-i-c dot i-n, starting first December two thousand twenty four.

unnormalised: This year, over 35 lakh students are expected to appear for the CBSE board exams across India and several international centers. The Board has implemented several measures to ensure fair and smooth conduct of the examinations, including increased CCTV surveillance and stricter invigilation protocols. Students are advised to download their admit cards from the CBSE website at least 1 week prior to the commencement of their respective examinations.
normalised: This year, over thirty five lakh students are expected to appear for the C-B-S-E board exams across India and several international centers. The Board has implemented several measures to ensure fair and smooth conduct of the examinations, including increased C-C-T-V surveillance and stricter invigilation protocols. Students are advised to download their admit cards from the C-B-S-E website at least one week prior to the commencement of their respective examinations.

unnormalised: "We are committed to providing a stress-free and equitable environment for all students appearing for the Class 10 and 12 examinations," stated Mr. Manoj Ahuja, Chairman, CBSE. He urged students to focus on their preparation and adhere to the guidelines issued by the Board. Results are tentatively scheduled to be declared in the 2nd week of May, 2025.
normalised: "We are committed to providing a stress-free and equitable environment for all students appearing for the Class ten and twelve examinations," stated Mister Manoj Ahuja, Chairman, C-B-S-E. He urged students to focus on their preparation and adhere to the guidelines issued by the Board. Results are tentatively scheduled to be declared in the second week of May, two thousand twenty five.
